CREATURE.name: Wizard
CREATURE.significance: Wizards and witches are central to the narrative, driving the plot and forming the magical world.

CREATURE.name: Witch
CREATURE.significance: Similar to wizards, witches play a crucial role in the story's magical world.

CREATURE.name: Muggle
CREATURE.significance: Muggles represent the ordinary world in contrast to the magical world, and Harry's upbringing with the Dursleys highlights this difference.

CREATURE.name: Ghost
CREATURE.description: Spirits of deceased wizards and witches that inhabit Hogwarts.
CREATURE.significance: Ghosts add to the magical atmosphere of Hogwarts and sometimes offer insights or guidance.

CREATURE.name: Three-headed dog
CREATURE.description: A monstrous dog named Fluffy that guards the trapdoor leading to the Philosopher's Stone.
CREATURE.significance: Fluffy is a significant obstacle in protecting the Stone, adding to the suspense and danger of the story.

CREATURE.name: Owl
CREATURE.description: Birds used by wizards and witches for communication and delivering mail.
CREATURE.significance: Owls are a common part of the wizarding world, facilitating communication and adding to the magical setting.

CREATURE.name: Cat
CREATURE.significance: McGonagall's ability to transform into a cat allows her to observe events discreetly and adds to her mystique.

CREATURE.name: Centaur
CREATURE.description: Creatures with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse, inhabiting the Forbidden Forest.
CREATURE.significance: Centaurs represent a connection to nature and possess knowledge of the future through astrology.

CREATURE.name: Dragon
CREATURE.description: Magical creatures that breathe fire. Hagrid illegally hatches a Norwegian Ridgeback.
CREATURE.significance: Norbert the dragon creates a subplot and highlights Hagrid's love for magical creatures, even dangerous ones.

CREATURE.name: Goblin
CREATURE.description: Creatures that run Gringotts Wizarding Bank.
CREATURE.significance: Goblins manage the wizarding finances and add to the diversity of the magical world.

CREATURE.name: Troll
CREATURE.description: Large, dim-witted creatures. One infiltrates Hogwarts on Halloween.
CREATURE.significance: The troll incident provides a challenge for Harry, Ron, and Hermione, solidifying their friendship and demonstrating their bravery.

CREATURE.name: Unicorn
CREATURE.description: Pure and magical creatures whose blood can prolong life but at a terrible cost.
CREATURE.significance: The unicorn's death and the consumption of its blood by Voldemort highlight the dark magic at play and the lengths to which Voldemort will go to regain power.

CREATURE.name: Vampire
CREATURE.description: Dark creatures that Professor Quirrell claims to have encountered.
CREATURE.significance: Vampires are mentioned as part of the curriculum for Defence Against the Dark Arts and contribute to the darker aspects of the wizarding world.

CREATURE.name: Werewolf
CREATURE.description: Humans who transform into wolves during a full moon.
CREATURE.significance: Werewolves are mentioned as dangerous creatures inhabiting the Forbidden Forest, adding to the sense of danger and mystery.

CREATURE.name: Poltergeist
CREATURE.description: A mischievous spirit that haunts Hogwarts, known as Peeves.
CREATURE.significance: Peeves adds to the chaotic and unpredictable nature of Hogwarts, often causing trouble for students and staff.

EVENT.name: Harry's Arrival at Privet Drive
EVENT.summary: A mysterious man named Albus Dumbledore and a woman who transforms into a cat, Professor McGonagall, leave baby Harry Potter on the Dursleys' doorstep after the death of his parents.  A letter explaining the situation is left with him.

EVENT.name: The Vanishing Glass
EVENT.summary: At the zoo, Harry communicates with a boa constrictor, and the glass of its enclosure mysteriously disappears, allowing the snake to escape.

EVENT.name: The Letters from No One
EVENT.summary: Harry begins receiving letters addressed to him, which the Dursleys intercept and destroy. The letters keep arriving through various means, increasing in number.

EVENT.name: Hagrid's Arrival
EVENT.summary: Rubeus Hagrid, a giant, arrives at the Dursleys' temporary hideout and reveals to Harry that he is a wizard and has been accepted into Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

EVENT.name: Trip to Diagon Alley
EVENT.summary: Hagrid takes Harry to Diagon Alley, a hidden street for wizards, where they withdraw money from Harry's vault at Gringotts bank and purchase his school supplies, including a wand and an owl named Hedwig.

EVENT.name: Journey to Hogwarts
EVENT.summary: Harry travels to Hogwarts by boarding the Hogwarts Express from the hidden Platform Nine and Three-Quarters. He meets Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger on the train.

EVENT.name: The Sorting Ceremony
EVENT.summary: At Hogwarts, the first-year students are sorted into their houses by the Sorting Hat. Harry, Ron, and Hermione are placed in Gryffindor.

EVENT.name: The Midnight Duel
EVENT.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione encounter a three-headed dog named Fluffy guarding a trapdoor on the third floor.  They later have a near-confrontation with Malfoy, but are interrupted by Filch.

EVENT.name: Harry's First Quidditch Match
EVENT.summary: Harry plays his first Quidditch match as Gryffindor's Seeker and catches the Golden Snitch, winning the game. Snape is suspected of jinxing Harry's broom during the match.

EVENT.name: Norbert the Norwegian Ridgeback
EVENT.summary: Hagrid acquires a dragon egg, which hatches into a Norwegian Ridgeback named Norbert. Harry, Ron, and Hermione help Hagrid send Norbert to Charlie Weasley in Romania.

EVENT.name: The Forbidden Forest
EVENT.summary: Harry, Hermione, Neville, and Malfoy serve detention in the Forbidden Forest with Hagrid. Harry encounters a hooded figure drinking unicorn blood and is saved by a centaur named Firenze.

EVENT.name: Protecting the Philosopher's Stone
EVENT.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione face a series of challenges protecting the Philosopher's Stone, including Devil's Snare, flying keys, a giant chess set, and a logic puzzle. Harry confronts Quirrell, who reveals that Voldemort is possessing him.

EVENT.name: Voldemort's Defeat
EVENT.summary: Harry confronts Quirrell/Voldemort in the final chamber. Quirrell is unable to touch Harry due to his mother's love and is ultimately defeated. The Philosopher's Stone is destroyed.

ORGANIZATION.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
ORGANIZATION.description: A school for young witches and wizards
ORGANIZATION.significance: The primary setting for the narrative and central to Harry's development as a wizard.

ORGANIZATION.name: Grunnings
ORGANIZATION.description: A firm that makes drills, where Mr. Dursley works
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; establishes Mr. Dursley's character and the Dursleys' ordinary world.

ORGANIZATION.name: Smeltings
ORGANIZATION.description: A private school for boys, where Dudley attends
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; contrasts with Hogwarts and reinforces Dudley's privileged upbringing.

ORGANIZATION.name: Stonewall High
ORGANIZATION.description: A local comprehensive school where Harry is supposed to attend
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; represents Harry's ordinary life before discovering his magical heritage.

ORGANIZATION.name: Ministry of Magic
ORGANIZATION.description: The governing body of the wizarding world
ORGANIZATION.significance: Mentioned; hints at the larger wizarding world and its political structure.

ORGANIZATION.name: Gringotts
ORGANIZATION.description: A bank run by goblins for wizards and witches
ORGANIZATION.significance: Important; holds Harry's inheritance and a hidden object related to the main plot.

ORGANIZATION.name: Order of Merlin
ORGANIZATION.description: An honor bestowed upon wizards and witches for outstanding achievements
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; part of Dumbledore's title, indicating his high status in the wizarding world.

ORGANIZATION.name: International Confederation of Wizards
ORGANIZATION.significance: Minor; part of Dumbledore's title, suggesting a global wizarding community.

ORGANIZATION.name: Gryffindor
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for bravery, chivalry, and daring
ORGANIZATION.significance: Major; Harry's house, influencing his relationships and experiences at Hogwarts.

ORGANIZATION.name: Hufflepuff
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for loyalty, hard work, and dedication
ORGANIZATION.significance: Mentioned; one of the four houses at Hogwarts.

ORGANIZATION.name: Ravenclaw
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for intelligence, learning, and wisdom
ORGANIZATION.significance: Mentioned; one of the four houses at Hogwarts.

ORGANIZATION.name: Slytherin
ORGANIZATION.description: One of the four houses at Hogwarts, known for ambition, cunning, and resourcefulness
ORGANIZATION.significance: Major; the house of Harry's rival, Draco Malfoy, and associated with dark wizards.

CONCEPT.name: Wizardry
CONCEPT.description: The ability to perform magic, central to the plot and a defining characteristic of certain individuals like Harry and his parents. It's a source of wonder and adventure, but also danger, requiring responsible use and control.

CONCEPT.name: The Dark Arts
CONCEPT.description: A form of magic associated with evil and malevolent intentions. Voldemort's use of the Dark Arts is a major threat, and Defence Against the Dark Arts is a crucial subject at Hogwarts.

CONCEPT.name: Voldemort's Curse
CONCEPT.description: The specific curse used by Voldemort to kill Harry's parents and attempt to kill Harry. It's a powerful and destructive force, leaving Harry with a lightning-bolt scar and a mysterious connection to Voldemort.

CONCEPT.name: Love's Protection
CONCEPT.description: The protective power of Lily Potter's love for Harry, which shielded him from Voldemort's curse. This magical force is a central theme, highlighting the power of love against evil.

CONCEPT.name: The Philosopher's Stone
CONCEPT.description: A legendary alchemical substance that can grant immortality and create gold. It's the central object of the plot, sought by Voldemort for his return to power and protected by Dumbledore at Hogwarts.

CONCEPT.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
CONCEPT.description: The magical school where Harry learns about wizardry and discovers his true identity. It's a place of learning, adventure, and friendship, but also harbors secrets and dangers.

CONCEPT.name: The Sorting Hat
CONCEPT.description: A magical hat that sorts students into their respective houses at Hogwarts. It represents the values and characteristics associated with each house, influencing the students' social circles and experiences.

CONCEPT.name: House Rivalry
CONCEPT.description: The competition and sometimes animosity between the four houses at Hogwarts. This rivalry plays a role in the plot, particularly the conflict between Gryffindor and Slytherin.

CONCEPT.name: Prophecy and Destiny
CONCEPT.description: The idea of predetermined events and roles, hinted at by the centaurs' interpretations of the stars and Voldemort's belief in Harry's destiny. This concept adds a layer of mystery and intrigue to the narrative.

CONCEPT.name: The Power of Names
CONCEPT.description: The significance of using Voldemort's true name, as emphasized by Dumbledore. It represents overcoming fear and confronting evil directly.

CHARACTER.name: Harry Potter
CHARACTER.description: Unhappy orphan, skinny, black hair, green eyes, round glasses, lightning bolt scar on forehead.

CHARACTER.name: Vernon Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Large, beefy man with a moustache, director of Grunnings.

CHARACTER.name: Petunia Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Thin, blonde, nosy woman, Harry's aunt.

CHARACTER.name: Dudley Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Large, blond, spoiled boy, Harry's cousin.

CHARACTER.name: Albus Dumbledore
CHARACTER.description: Tall, thin, very old, silver hair and beard, half-moon spectacles, long robes, Headmaster of Hogwarts.

CHARACTER.name: Minerva McGonagall
CHARACTER.description: Severe-looking woman, square glasses, black hair in a bun, emerald robes, Deputy Headmistress.

CHARACTER.name: Rubeus Hagrid
CHARACTER.description: Twice as tall as a normal man, wild black hair and beard, hands the size of dustbin lids.

CHARACTER.name: Sirius Black
CHARACTER.description: Lent Hagrid his flying motorbike.

CHARACTER.name: James Potter
CHARACTER.description: Harry's father.

CHARACTER.name: Lily Potter
CHARACTER.description: Harry's mother.

CHARACTER.name: Piers Polkiss
CHARACTER.description: Scrawny boy, Dudley's friend.

CHARACTER.name: Dedalus Diggle
CHARACTER.description: Man in a violet top hat.

CHARACTER.name: Ron Weasley
CHARACTER.description: Tall, thin, gangling, freckles, big hands and feet, long nose, red hair.

CHARACTER.name: Hermione Granger
CHARACTER.description: Bossy, bushy brown hair, large front teeth, very clever.

CHARACTER.name: Draco Malfoy
CHARACTER.description: Pale, pointed face, rich, arrogant.

CHARACTER.name: Vincent Crabbe
CHARACTER.description: Thickset, mean, Malfoy's friend.

CHARACTER.name: Gregory Goyle
CHARACTER.description: Thickset, mean, Malfoy's friend.

CHARACTER.name: Neville Longbottom
CHARACTER.description: Round-faced, forgetful, accident-prone.

CHARACTER.name: Oliver Wood
CHARACTER.description: Burly fifth-year, Gryffindor Quidditch captain.

CHARACTER.name: Severus Snape
CHARACTER.description: Greasy black hair, hooked nose, sallow skin, Potions Master.

CHARACTER.name: Argus Filch
CHARACTER.description: Caretaker of Hogwarts, pale, wild eyes.

CHARACTER.name: Mrs. Norris
CHARACTER.description: Scrawny, dust-colored cat with bulging eyes, Filch's cat.

CHARACTER.name: Professor Sprout
CHARACTER.description: Dumpy little witch, Herbology teacher.

CHARACTER.name: Professor Flitwick
CHARACTER.description: Tiny little wizard, Charms teacher.

CHARACTER.name: Professor Binns
CHARACTER.description: History of Magic teacher.

CHARACTER.name: Nearly Headless Nick
CHARACTER.description: Gryffindor ghost.

CHARACTER.name: Peeves
CHARACTER.description: Mischievous poltergeist.

CHARACTER.name: The Bloody Baron
CHARACTER.description: Slytherin ghost, gaunt face, robes stained with silver blood.

CHARACTER.name: Fluffy
CHARACTER.description: Giant three-headed dog.

CHARACTER.name: Nicolas Flamel
CHARACTER.description: Noted alchemist and opera lover, maker of the Philosopher's Stone.

CHARACTER.name: Perenelle Flamel
CHARACTER.description: Nicolas Flamel's wife.

CHARACTER.name: Lord Voldemort
CHARACTER.description: Chalk white with glaring red eyes and slits for nostrils, like a snake.

CHARACTER.name: Ginny Weasley
CHARACTER.description: Ron's younger sister.

CHARACTER.name: Percy Weasley
CHARACTER.description: Ron's older brother, a Prefect.

CHARACTER.name: Fred Weasley
CHARACTER.description: One of Ron's older twin brothers, a Beater.

CHARACTER.name: George Weasley
CHARACTER.description: One of Ron's older twin brothers, a Beater.

CHARACTER.name: Charlie Weasley
CHARACTER.description: Ron's older brother, studies dragons in Romania.

CHARACTER.name: Bill Weasley
CHARACTER.description: Ron's older brother, works for Gringotts in Africa.

LOCATION.name: Privet Drive
LOCATION.description: A quiet, ordinary suburban street where the Dursleys live at number four. It is described as tidy and neat, with well-maintained gardens.  The street represents the mundane, non-magical world that Harry comes from.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's childhood home with the Dursleys, representing his difficult upbringing and contrast with the wizarding world.

LOCATION.name: Number Four, Privet Drive
LOCATION.description: The Dursleys' home, a perfectly ordinary suburban house. It has four bedrooms and a garden. Harry lives in the cupboard under the stairs for ten years.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's unhappy childhood home, a symbol of his neglect and the Dursleys' rejection of his magical nature.

LOCATION.name: Cupboard under the Stairs
LOCATION.description: Harry's small, cramped living space for the first ten years of his life. It is described as being full of spiders and represents Harry's isolation and mistreatment.
LOCATION.significance: A symbol of Harry's neglect and mistreatment by the Dursleys.

LOCATION.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
LOCATION.description: A magical boarding school for young witches and wizards. It is a vast, ancient castle with many towers, turrets, and secret passages. The school is full of magical creatures, ghosts, and enchantments.
LOCATION.significance: The primary setting for Harry's magical education and adventures.

LOCATION.name: Diagon Alley
LOCATION.description: A hidden street in London where witches and wizards purchase their supplies. It is full of unusual shops selling magical items such as wands, cauldrons, and spell books.
LOCATION.significance: Harry's introduction to the wizarding world and its resources.

LOCATION.name: The Leaky Cauldron
LOCATION.description: A wizarding pub and inn that serves as a gateway to Diagon Alley. It is described as dark, shabby, but welcoming to the wizarding community.
LOCATION.significance: A point of transition between the Muggle and wizarding worlds.

LOCATION.name: Gringotts Wizarding Bank
LOCATION.description: The only bank in the wizarding world, run by goblins. It is located deep underground and is said to be guarded by dragons.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry learns about his inheritance and the location of a mysterious item.

LOCATION.name: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions
LOCATION.description: A shop in Diagon Alley where witches and wizards purchase their robes and other clothing.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry meets Draco Malfoy for the first time.

LOCATION.name: Eeylops Owl Emporium
LOCATION.description: A shop in Diagon Alley that sells owls and other magical creatures.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry buys his owl, Hedwig.

LOCATION.name: Flourish and Blotts
LOCATION.description: A bookshop in Diagon Alley that sells a wide variety of magical books, from large tomes to tiny spell books.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry buys his school books.

LOCATION.name: Ollivanders
LOCATION.description: A small, ancient wand shop run by Garrick Ollivander. It is filled with thousands of wand boxes.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry receives his wand, which has a significant connection to Voldemort.

LOCATION.name: Platform Nine and Three-Quarters
LOCATION.description: A hidden platform at King's Cross Station from which the Hogwarts Express departs.
LOCATION.significance: Another point of transition between the Muggle and wizarding worlds.

LOCATION.name: Hogwarts Express
LOCATION.description: The scarlet steam train that takes students to and from Hogwarts.
LOCATION.significance: Part of the journey to Hogwarts and a place where Harry meets his new friends.

LOCATION.name: The Great Hall
LOCATION.description: The main dining hall at Hogwarts, where students eat meals and school events are held. It has a bewitched ceiling that mimics the sky outside.
LOCATION.significance: Location of the Sorting Ceremony and many other important school gatherings.

LOCATION.name: Gryffindor Common Room
LOCATION.description: A cozy, circular room with squashy armchairs and a fireplace, exclusive to Gryffindor students.
LOCATION.significance: A place of comfort and belonging for Harry and his housemates.

LOCATION.name: Hagrid's Hut
LOCATION.description: A small wooden house on the edge of the Forbidden Forest where Hagrid lives. It is often filled with the smell of cooking and various creatures.
LOCATION.significance: A place of refuge and friendship for Harry, Ron, and Hermione.

LOCATION.name: Quidditch Pitch
LOCATION.description: The large field where Hogwarts Quidditch matches are held. It has stands for spectators and three golden hoops at each end.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry discovers his talent for Quidditch.

LOCATION.name: Forbidden Forest
LOCATION.description: A dark and dangerous forest bordering the Hogwarts grounds, home to various magical creatures.
LOCATION.significance: A place of mystery and danger, where Harry encounters Voldemort and learns about unicorn blood.

LOCATION.name: The Trophy Room
LOCATION.description: A room in Hogwarts where trophies and awards are displayed. It is filled with glittering cups, shields, and statues.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry and Malfoy almost have a duel.

LOCATION.name: The Mirror of Erised Room
LOCATION.description: An abandoned classroom where the Mirror of Erised is hidden. The mirror shows the viewer their deepest desires.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry sees his parents for the first time and learns about the mirror's power.

LOCATION.name: Hospital Wing
LOCATION.description: The school infirmary run by Madam Pomfrey. It is where students are treated for injuries and illnesses.
LOCATION.significance: Where Harry recovers after his encounters with Voldemort.

LOCATION.name: Hogsmeade
LOCATION.description: A small all-wizarding village near Hogwarts.
LOCATION.significance: Hagrid visits the Hog's Head pub here and receives Norbert the dragon egg.

LOCATION.name: The Hog's Head
LOCATION.description: A less reputable wizarding pub in Hogsmeade.
LOCATION.significance: Where Hagrid wins Norbert in a card game.

ITEM.name: Letter to Harry
ITEM.description: A letter addressed to Harry Potter informing him of his acceptance into Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
ITEM.origin: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

ITEM.name: Put-Outer
ITEM.description: A silver cigarette lighter-like device used by Albus Dumbledore to extinguish street lamps.

ITEM.name: Hagrid's Umbrella
ITEM.description: A battered pink umbrella used by Rubeus Hagrid, possibly concealing his broken wand.

ITEM.name: Flying Motorbike
ITEM.description: A motorbike used by Hagrid to transport baby Harry Potter, borrowed from Sirius Black.

ITEM.name: Dudley's Presents
ITEM.description: Numerous gifts received by Dudley Dursley for his birthday, including a computer, television, racing bike, and more.

ITEM.name: Smeltings Stick
ITEM.description: A knobbly stick carried by Smeltings schoolboys, used for hitting each other.

ITEM.name: Harry's School Uniform
ITEM.description: Dudley's old clothes dyed grey by Aunt Petunia for Harry to wear to Stonewall High.

ITEM.name: Letters from Hogwarts
ITEM.description: Multiple letters addressed to Harry, informing him of his acceptance to Hogwarts. They arrive through various means, including by owl, under the door, and in eggs.
ITEM.origin: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

ITEM.name: Hagrid's Rock Cakes
ITEM.description: Rock cakes baked by Hagrid, described as very hard.

ITEM.name: Wizard Money
ITEM.description: Wizarding currency consisting of Galleons, Sickles, and Knuts.

ITEM.name: Harry's Wand
ITEM.description: An eleven-inch holly wand with a phoenix feather core, chosen by Harry at Ollivanders.

ITEM.name: Hedwig
ITEM.description: Harry's snowy owl, a gift from Hagrid.

ITEM.name: The Daily Prophet
ITEM.description: The wizarding newspaper.

ITEM.name: Remembrall
ITEM.description: A small glass ball filled with white smoke that turns red when its owner has forgotten something.

ITEM.name: Nimbus Two Thousand
ITEM.description: Harry's new broomstick, a gift from Professor McGonagall.

ITEM.name: Sorting Hat
ITEM.description: A sentient hat that sorts students into Hogwarts houses.

ITEM.name: Invisibility Cloak
ITEM.description: A cloak that makes the wearer invisible, inherited from Harry's father.

ITEM.name: Philosopher's Stone
ITEM.description: A legendary substance that can turn any metal into gold and produce the Elixir of Life.

ITEM.name: Fluffy
ITEM.description: A giant three-headed dog owned by Hagrid, guarding the trapdoor to the Philosopher's Stone.

ITEM.name: Norbert
ITEM.description: A Norwegian Ridgeback dragon hatched by Hagrid.

ITEM.name: Mirror of Erised
ITEM.description: A mirror that shows the viewer their deepest desires.

ITEM.name: Potions Kit
ITEM.description: A set of equipment for potion-making, including scales, phials, and ingredients.

ITEM.name: Flying Keys
ITEM.description: Enchanted keys with wings, used to access a door.

ITEM.name: Devil's Snare
ITEM.description: A dangerous plant that traps anyone who touches it.

ITEM.name: Photo Album
ITEM.description: A gift from Hagrid, containing photos of Harry's parents.
